A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Never before has a film offered such an entertaining ride only to have it sour so woefully once the end credits rolled.  That is because the film itself was constructed to cover the real intent of severing itself from the original fan base. This covert tactic only sparked the true rebellion and showed that we original fans have a powerful voice left in us.

Understand this.  It's not that the filmmakers were unknowledgeable about the legacy.  This was a clear agenda to dismantle what had inspired so many\, only to forge perpetual wealth for the franchise going forward.

I have no issues with a new direction for a film series\, but this entry actually impacts the beloved original saga in a way that we cannot wipe it out from our minds.

Low blow\, but not unexpected.  I think we are really in a dire state if we are now relying on Abrams as the savior.  Who served as a producer in this encoded installment\, let us not forget.

My suggestion would be for creative minds to use this as inspiration to write their own stories.  To look for inspiration with today's movies is a foolish errand at this point.  The Last Jedi is but the latest proof of this.
